alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Harrison; Jefferson (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 02 at 7:02PM EDT until July 02 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL HARRISON...WEST CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTIES... At 702 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles south of Carrollton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Scio, Amsterdam, Kilgore, and Harlem Springs. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
